title: How safe is America from polio?
description: After decades of American children routinely receiving polio vaccines, the virus that had doomed many to paralysis was nearly eliminated in the United States. But vaccine avoidance today may allow the crippling disease to return.

title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (Feb. 22)
description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

title: Malawi vaccinates a new generation of children against polio, which still hasn't been eradicated
description: The southern African nation of Malawi has launched a new polio vaccination campaign this week in another reminder that the world still hasn’t managed to eradicate the disease despite a concerted effort for more than 35 years

title: The measles vaccine: A product of two centuries of science and public health reform
description: For much of the 20th century, measles was regarded as an unavoidable illness of childhood, even as it killed millions of people worldwide each year. The development of a safe and effective vaccine fundamentally changed that reality.

title: What Else Can We Do? The Thirteen Intentions of Philanthropy
description:
A year of turbulence has exposed the dangers of philanthropic monocultures
and upended assumptions about impact, effectiveness, and scale. Embracing the
varied intentions that motivate people to give offers a more resilient,
pluralistic path forward.

title: Improved immunisation key to fight variant poliovirus strains: Expert
description:
Oral polio vaccines (OPVs) are safe, effective and central to global eradication efforts, but there is a need for improved immunisation to combat the emergence of vaccine-derived poliovirus strains, a US-based public health expert said.
Referring to India's c…

title: Rational design and in vivo validation of capsid inhibitors for enterovirus D68
description: In this study, the authors designed potent Enterovirus D68 capsid inhibitors that block viral binding and show that the lead compounds reduce virus levels, prevent paralysis and improve survival in EV-D68-challenged mice, even when treatment starts days after…

title: Why US-funded vaccine trial plan for babies in Guinea-Bissau caused outrage
description: The health trial by researchers at the University of Southern Denmark has been suspended by Bissau-Guinean authorities.

description: One of RFK Jr.’s vaccine advisers recently floated the idea of stopping vaccination against the virus. It would be catastrophic.

title: Vaccine Advisory Board Chair: Would Polio Really Be Such A Bad Time?

description: Dr. Kirk Milhoan, head of the CDC's vaccine advisory panel, questioned whether broad recommendations are necessary for polio vaccines and other shots.
